alert.note: Alert for Northern Monterey Bay (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 06 at 2:54AM PST until December 07 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Breaking waves of 9 to 13 feet expected. * WHERE...Northern Monterey Bay County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Large waves can sweep across the beach without warning, pulling people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Large northwest waves will peak this morning. Northwest facing beaches are most at risk for large, turbulent shore break and strong currents.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions. Larger breaking waves along the coast will lead to increased run- up on beaches with waves topping and washing over large rocks and jetties. Use caution near the surf zone as these larger waves will be capable of sweeping people into the water. Avoid rocks and jetties. Avoid steep beaches. Stay farther back from the water and never turn your back on the ocean.
